page.title: 01LONGFORD AREA
page.content: { Longford is a small and attractive village. It has pretty houses and interesting buildings like the cheese factory, the mill, the pump house and the old school. The cheese factory is used for storing grain now_a_days, but it was the first cheese factory to be built. The mill is next to the brook and sometimes they turn the big wheel. The pump house is a strange building, it used to pump water in the old days. Not actually in the village is Longford Hall. It is a manor house. Next door to the Hall is the church. It is unusual for a church to be out of the village. In this area we have cattle and crops. We grow wheat, barley, oilseed rape, peas and potatoes.
